title: Fournier + Operina + Caslon?
content:
I’m doing a sort of underground magazine at my college, and I’m thinking of using Fournier for the text and [P22’s Franklin’s Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329212523/http:/www.p22.com/products/franklin.html) for the main display, giving it a little bit of a period feel. I’d like something else for everything else (pull quotes, etc.), and I was thinking about [P22’s Operina](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329212523/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/operinapro.html)… it feels a little like a clash though. Can anyone recommend some substitutions (for any of the three but especially Operina)?

Many thanks,  
Zach.
author: Zach

comments.content: Igino Marini’s [Fell Types](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329212523/http:/www.iginomarini.com/fell.html) have the same ye olde letterpress feel.
You could use the Caslon italic for the pull quotes and the roman for the display type which would bring you down to two fonts instead of three.
I like ye Fell types… thanks!
